We review and approve every submission against our Community Guidelines before it is published to the site..
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself as an employee?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MedStar Health
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed, easy interview process
Interview Questions: How well do you get along with your peers

title: Applications Analyst III Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at MedStar Health
Interview Descriptions: Smooth process
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview with head of therapy, followed by observing with another occupational therapist
Interview Questions: Don't remember

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health (White Marsh, MD) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had to do 3 interviews. Different teams will interview and the team that likes you the most would make an offer. The process took about two weeks because of other team leaders being out of town.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Full Time Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MedStar Health
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with a staff member.  Then I came in and met the Director and then was interviewed by a committee who had several questions prepared for me.  The entire process took about 2 hours.
Interview Questions: Tell us about the last conflict that you had with a physician and how you resolved it.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview not very indept, very fast
Interview Questions: none really. Typical interview questions

title: BHS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Baltimore, MD) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Fairly typical.  No big issues or questions to throw someone off.  The interview was rather general in nature.  It was not something that I was going to lose sleep over the night before.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths and weaknesses

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at MedStar Health
Interview Descriptions: The process was painfully slow and left a negative impression.  The initial interview was scheduled (interviewed with the hiring manager and 2 other associates).  I left feeling great and excited about the position.  About two months went by and I assumed another candidate was hired, however, I was unexpectedly brought in for a 2nd interview to meet with the hiring managers's boss.  She not only arrived 25 minutes late, with no explanation, but her tone was cold, dry, and discouraging.  Although the hiring manager had been pleasant and encouraging, her boss left me feeling like the corporate environment was unwelcoming and rigid, not to mention the lack of work-life balance.  Although I thought my hospital background would benefit and bring much needed insight to the corporate environment, she essentially told me that hospital associates do not work out well in the corporate environment.  My interest level dropped significantly.  Months went by again before I heard another word.  Another candidate was hired... I wish them well.  I will never interview for another MedStar corporate position again.  It was an experience... but not a good one.
Interview Questions: How will you make decisions when there is not a concensus?

title: Unit Secrtary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied  for the position and then researched the department manager's email and phone number. After receiving that information I then waiting about two weeks, and proceeded to email about the status of my application every two weeks after that. I was called in for an interview with the hiring manager, then I had to take a drug test. After which, I had to wait for them to set up an appointment for me to have a physical done. And then wait for the start of orientation.
Interview Questions: The questions that were asked were easy and straight forward. "How will you help the company meet its customer satisfaction goals?" What are your career goals?" "Why do you want to work for the company?" "What do you look for in a manager/supervisor?"

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Washington, DC) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: It moved very quickly and I had an offer within a couple weeks of applying. The interviews were fairly laid back and the people were very friendly. I had two separate interviews (one preliminary with a couple of people and then one final interview). Overall, I would say that it was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Baltimore, MD) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Apply, recruiter contacts and sets up interview, completed one interview and was extended an offer within 2 weeks as stated.  There was phone follow-up with the Director to provide me information as to what to expect next in the process.
Interview Questions: How do I perform in times of turbulance?

title: Business Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Washington, DC) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed directly with the manager for the facility. It wasn't difficult at all or the standard interview from what I remember. The manager seemed sort of friendly during the process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Washington, DC) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and efficient. It was pleasant and my time was valued - the interview began on time and all of the pertinent individuals were present. The questions were straight-forward. An offer was provided within the next week.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Baltimore, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was hard. They were very scrutinizing. I wasn't sure if I was being interviewed for a job or for my life. It was very intimidating. I would not like to be interviewed in that way again. Hadn't seen a lot of fun people's around either. It was very business no fun type of thing.
Interview Questions: What school did u graduate from.

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Baltimore, MD) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on the MedStar website. I received a phone screening a few days later from a HR recruiter. I then interviewed 1:1 with my boss and  then was hired within a month. The background check and physical took a few days to get results.
Interview Questions: What do I want to do?

title: EMR Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Washington, DC) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted to interview for the position as I had extensive experience with the EMR while conducting an internship at the hospital. Previous manager had informed the position manager that I was available and experienced with the EMR. I had worked previously with the manager so interview was more or less a formality but was good to touch base and see what she expected from the position and what I was looking for in the position to ensure it met the expectations.
Interview Questions: When is a time that you personally used the SPIRT values. Describe a time when you had to deal with an aggressive patient/ situation and how did you deal with?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at MedStar Health in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
3 interviews total,1 with the administrator, 2 with financial team, 3 with the doctor
Each interview was over 30 minutes long. Some seemed unorganized and unprepared.  Wait for interview to begin was about an hour.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in this company?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Columbia, MD) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Take a long time to get an interview
Interview Questions: Lousy salary and raises

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Nottingham, MD) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was fairly easy. I felt as though the Supervisor of the department I was hired for had great interest in my assets and how I could help them balance in that specific department. I felt as though, the Supervisor was very satisfied with my credentials.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Practice Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MedStar Health in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial communications occured more than one month after submitting my application.  The interviewer was direct and precise with setting up the interview date and time.  I met first with the Executive Director and was invited back for a second interview with the physician group.  I then interviewed with three physicians and the Executive Director at the second interview.  I received an offer more than one month after the second interview.
Interview Questions: The most unexpected question was: "You seem to be very confident.  Does anything ever rattle you and what do you do when you get upset or angry?"

title: Strategic Planning Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Columbia, MD) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and was emailed within 24hrs and asked to come for 1:1 interview the next day. Initial interview was with hiring manager (Strategic Planning Manger) and was relatively informal and friendly, approx. 90 mins, including a lot of 2 way information sharing (i.e. she was keen to tell me all about the company and working arrangements too). She decided in front of me to make me the last of 3 candidates to come back for second round interviews.

Second round interviews took place about 10 days later. Consisted of 3 separate interviews of 45-60mins each:
1) Market Research Manager
2) Business Developemnt Manager
3) Two analysts, who would be my co-workers

Everyone was very friendly and professional. All 3 senior managers genuinely seemed to enjoy working there and had been there for aout 5 years each. Interviews consisted of many typical questions ("what can you bring to the company?", "what are your strengths" etc) but also fairly honest accounts of work ethic and environment. Employee comments included:
-Good work-life balance. 8:30-5 is typical. Not usually expected to work overtime. Good paid leave allowance.
-Almost everyone has own office. Good for getting work done but quite isolated.
-Very hierarchical structure. Analyst reports to one manager who may then take work up the chain. Analyst may never see work again, or receive acknowledgement or credit, or be involved in more senior meetings.
-Most work is done independently rather than team oriented. Most co-worker relationships developed informally i.e. work lunches etc rather than during office hours.

Corridors were immaculate and offices were large. Whole place was VERY quiet. Seemed a good environment if you like sitting still and getting on with your own work, but not overly social or collaborative.

It should be noted that Medstar is a large corporation and that departments are organised and run very differently. 

Best advice if going into similar format is to take notes with you and/or a list of questions to ask each interviewer. I was tired by the end of the third interview and had clearly run out of questions and extra things to say which probably made me look a little disorganised. At the end of the 3 second round interviews I was then met in the corridor by the original hiring manager who asked me what I thought, what stood out, and if I had any more questions. I was not expecting this and could have been better prepared for that, too! :-(
Interview Questions: What do you think you can bring to Medstar?

title: Hospice Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Leonardtown, MD) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Appointment made via phone by Human Resources Assistant.  In person interview with panel of staff at the facility.  No touring of facilty. Testing at separate site (Word, Excel, Secretary Skills).  Testing in the HR office is on an older computer with a non adjustable chair in an open office space.  There will be distractions. Notification by mail.
Interview Questions: Should a rule be broken if it makes no sense?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews.  The first with HR rep.  The next was with the entire department I was hired in to.  Mostly behavioral questions, asking about specific situations and tasks.
Interview Questions: nothing really.  Very situation specific and asking about my experience

title: Performance Improvement Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Baltimore, MD) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: One-on-one interview with department head.  Then group interview with department head and chief medical officer.  Next an interview with entire group with whom I'd be working.  (six people).  There were technical questions, behavioral questions, limited small talk.  Question were geared toward how I might make decisions; if I would defend departmental decisions; willingness to represent the department in physician/leadership forums.
Interview Questions: What gives you an advantage over all other applicants for this job?

title: Director of Compensation & Recruitmnt Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Clinton, MD) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process took too long to finalize.  The interview process was fine, met with different directors from different departments.
Interview Questions: How would i change the hiring process they had at the time?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: online application. was called and went in for 1:1 interview. drug test. background review. they called with offer
Interview Questions: how do you deal with stress

title: R N Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Baltimore, MD) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: The H.R. department doesn't know their heads from a hole in the ground, that being said, when it comes time to have an interview with the management department where you're hoping to work, is easy, seamless, and fair. Having been on the interviewing team for our department, I can say the questions we asked were fair, honest, and easier than other interview questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us the most important aspect of nursing?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Clinton, MD) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: I came to know about this job from a recruiter. It was a simple process where in i met the hiring manager and prceeded to the next steps.
Interview Questions: The most unexpected question was how i would deal,with certain patients. As this is a clincal job it is not always predicatble way of treatment.

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Washington, DC) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: I came through a recruiter initially 7 years ago, I was promoted within the departmental area as I showed promise and previous experience. From the first position, I always had to interview with 3 or 4 individuals (separately, for example, Administrator, Manager and Physician).
Interview Questions: We're a busy place, how do you deal with overwhelming situations and how do you deal with customers with difficulty behaviors?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at MedStar Health (Washington, DC) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Site manager took the interview for 15 mins
Interview Questions: none about PT skills
